title: Supreme Court connivances
author: VD
content_html:
Joseph Farah points out a telling bit of support from an interesting source:

John G. Roberts Jr. should be confirmed as chief justice of the United States. He is overwhelmingly well-qualified, possesses an unusually keen legal mind and practices a collegiality of the type an effective chief justice must have. He shows every sign of commitment to restraint and impartiality. Nominees of comparable quality have, after rigorous hearings, been confirmed nearly unanimously. We hope Judge Roberts will similarly be approved by a large bipartisan vote.

It’s a good thing that Dear Leader was reelected, because just think, if John Kerry had won, he might have nominated activist judges of whom the liberal mainstream media approves!

Oh, did I forget to mention that endorsement of Justice Roberts comes from the Washington Post? My dear Mr. Farah, I do believe that I told YOU and everyone else who supported George Bush so.

Joseph Farah
points out a telling bit of support
from an interesting source:
John G. Roberts Jr. should be confirmed as chief justice of the United States. He is overwhelmingly well-qualified, possesses an unusually keen legal mind and practices a collegiality of the type an effective chief justice must have. He shows every sign of commitment to restraint and impartiality. Nominees of comparable quality have, after rigorous hearings, been confirmed nearly unanimously. We hope Judge Roberts will similarly be approved by a large bipartisan vote.

Oh, did I forget to mention that endorsement of Justice Roberts comes from the Washington Post?  My dear Mr. Farah, I do believe that I told YOU and everyone else who supported George Bush so.
